abstract.p: About 3,800 production and office workers go on strike at Toronto plant of Bombardier Inc, which makes Dash-8 series turboprop aircraft and Global Express regional jets; Canadian Auto Workers union president Buzz Hargrove says company failed to satisfy union's pension and job security demands; Bombardier says 2,000 nonunion employees moved into assembly jobs to meet short-term deliveries; photo (S)

block.p: About 3,800 production and office workers have gone on strike at the Toronto plant of Bombardier Inc., which makes Dash-8 series turboprop aircraft and Global Express regional jets. The Canadian Auto Workers union walked off the job at the strike deadline yesterday morning. Buzz Hargrove, the union president, said the company had failed to satisfy the union's pension and job security demands. Bombardier said 2,000 non-union employees had been moved into assembly jobs to meet short-term deliveries.
